definition: lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight
to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: We should draw a moral from the startling fact.
sentences.chinese: 我们应当从这些触目惊心的事实中吸取教训。

sentences.english: The number of youngsters involved in crime is frightening .
sentences.chinese: 卷入犯罪的青少年人数令人触目惊心。

sentences.english: All the relevant food safety reports, shocking ah.
sentences.chinese: 这阵子有关食品安全的报道篇篇触目惊心啊。

sentences.english: At this time, the situation was appalling.
sentences.chinese: 当时清扫工的状况是触目惊心的。

sentences.english: "watchdog" Li Jinhua also opened a horrifying "list".
sentences.chinese: “看门狗”李金华又开出触目惊心的“清单”了。

sentences.english: I do not recall who the taste of the pain so startling .
sentences.chinese: 我不会想起谁，那般疼痛的滋味触目惊心。

sentences.english: Looking ahead, the whole chicken in a mess, shocking.
sentences.chinese: 放眼望去，整个鸡场狼藉一片，触目惊心。

definition: lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight/also written 觸目驚心|触目惊心
to be drenched with blood/dripping blood
spectacle too horrible to endure (idiom); tragic sight/appalling scenes of devastation
to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
shiver all over though not cold/tremble with fear/shudder
lit. the eye cannot bear to see it (idiom); a scene too pitiful to behold
